segment.source: Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (Windows 10)
segment.target: Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (Windows 10)

segment.source: This guide will walk you through the process of deploying Windows 10 in an enterprise environment using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), and MDT 2013 Update 2 specifically.
segment.target: This guide will walk you through the process of deploying Windows 10 in an enterprise environment using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), and MDT 2013 Update 2 specifically.

segment.source: Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit
segment.target: Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This guide will walk you through the process of deploying Windows 10 in an enterprise environment using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), and MDT 2013 Update 2 specifically.
segment.target: This guide will walk you through the process of deploying Windows 10 in an enterprise environment using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), and MDT 2013 Update 2 specifically.

segment.source: The Microsoft Deployment Toolkit is a unified collection of tools, processes, and guidance for automating desktop and server deployment.
segment.target: The Microsoft Deployment Toolkit is a unified collection of tools, processes, and guidance for automating desktop and server deployment.

segment.source: In addition to reducing deployment time and standardizing desktop and server images, MDT enables you to more easily manage security and ongoing configurations.
segment.target: In addition to reducing deployment time and standardizing desktop and server images, MDT enables you to more easily manage security and ongoing configurations.

segment.source: MDT builds on top of the core deployment tools in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) with additional guidance and features designed to reduce the complexity and time required for deployment in an enterprise environment.
segment.target: MDT builds on top of the core deployment tools in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) with additional guidance and features designed to reduce the complexity and time required for deployment in an enterprise environment.

segment.source: MDT 2013 Update 2 supports the deployment of Windows 10, as well as Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, and Windows Server 2012 R2.
segment.target: MDT 2013 Update 2 supports the deployment of Windows 10, as well as Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, and Windows Server 2012 R2.

segment.source: It also includes support for zero-touch installation (ZTI) with Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: It also includes support for zero-touch installation (ZTI) with Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: To download the latest version of MDT, visit the MDT resource page.
segment.target: To download the latest version of MDT, visit the MDT resource page.

segment.source: Proof-of-concept environment
segment.target: Proof-of-concept environment

segment.source: For the purposes of this guide, and the topics discussed herein, we will use the following servers and client machines: DC01, MDT01, CM01, PC0001, and PC0002.
segment.target: For the purposes of this guide, and the topics discussed herein, we will use the following servers and client machines: DC01, MDT01, CM01, PC0001, and PC0002.

segment.source: figure 1
segment.target: figure 1

segment.source: Figure 1.
segment.target: Figure 1.

segment.source: The servers and machines used for examples in this guide.
segment.target: The servers and machines used for examples in this guide.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller; the other servers and client machines are members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller; the other servers and client machines are members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.target: figure 2

segment.target: The organizational unit (OU) structure used in this guide.

segment.target: Server details

segment.source: DC01.
segment.target: DC01.

segment.source: A Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard machine, fully patched with the latest security updates, and configured as Active Directory Domain Controller, DNS Server, and DHCP Server in the contoso.com domain.
segment.target: A Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard machine, fully patched with the latest security updates, and configured as Active Directory Domain Controller, DNS Server, and DHCP Server in the contoso.com domain.

segment.target: Server name: DC01

segment.target: Roles: DNS, DHCP, and Domain Controller

segment.source: MDT01.
segment.target: MDT01.

segment.source: A Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard machine, fully patched with the latest security updates, and configured as a member server in the contoso.com domain.
segment.target: A Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard machine, fully patched with the latest security updates, and configured as a member server in the contoso.com domain.

segment.source: Sample files
segment.target: Sample files

segment.source: The information in this guide is designed to help you deploy Windows 10.
segment.target: The information in this guide is designed to help you deploy Windows 10.

segment.source: In order to help you put the information you learn into practice more quickly, we recommend that you download a small set of sample files for the fictitious Contoso Corporation:
segment.target: In order to help you put the information you learn into practice more quickly, we recommend that you download a small set of sample files for the fictitious Contoso Corporation:

segment.source: Gather.ps1.
segment.target: Gather.ps1.

segment.source: This sample Windows PowerShell script performs the MDT Gather process in a simulated MDT environment.
segment.target: This sample Windows PowerShell script performs the MDT Gather process in a simulated MDT environment.

segment.source: This allows you to test the MDT gather process and check to see if it is working correctly without performing a full Windows deployment.
segment.target: This allows you to test the MDT gather process and check to see if it is working correctly without performing a full Windows deployment.

segment.source: Set-OUPermissions.ps1.
segment.target: Set-OUPermissions.ps1.

segment.source: This sample Windows PowerShell script creates a domain account and then configures OU permissions to allow the account to join machines to the domain in the specified OU.
segment.target: This sample Windows PowerShell script creates a domain account and then configures OU permissions to allow the account to join machines to the domain in the specified OU.

segment.source: MDTSample.zip.
segment.target: MDTSample.zip.

segment.source: This sample web service shows you how to configure a computer name dynamically using MDT.
segment.target: This sample web service shows you how to configure a computer name dynamically using MDT.
